articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Sin Pyong Gang
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Sin Pyong Gang
 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un Saturday sent a wreath to the bier of Labor Hero Sin Pyong Gang, winner of Kim Il Sung Prize and Kim Jong Il Prize, deputy to the Supreme People's Assembly and director of the Literature and Art Studio of the Korean People's Army, expressing deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: Sports Successes for 2015 Reviewed in DPRK
articles.content:
Sports Successes for 2015 Reviewed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Sports successes for this year were reviewed with due ceremony at the People's Palace of Culture on Dec. 25.
					 Present there were leading officials in the field of physical culture and sports, chairpersons of sports event associations, leading officials of sponsoring bodies, and sports officials, sportspersons and coaches in Pyongyang.
					
					 Ri Il Hwan, department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea who doubles as vice-chairman of the State Physical Culture and Sports Guidance Commission, made a report.
					
					 He said sportspersons fully displayed the spirit of sports of Juche Korea by bagging many gold medals at international games.
					
					 He referred to the achievements made by the sports guidance organs and sports teams at all levels and juvenile sports schools in close touch with scientific research institutes, contributing to developing the sports science and technology of the country.
					
					 He noted a lot of sports facilities were newly built or remodeled to provide the sportspersons with good training and living conditions across the country.
					
					 The lists of 10 best players, 10 best coaches and 10 best Taekwon-do players of the DPRK for 2015 are made public.
					
					 Best players:
					
					 Ra Un Sim, football player of the Amnokgang Sports Team
					
					 Kim Kuk Hyang, diver of the April 25 Sports Team
					
					 Om Yun Chol, weightlifter of Amnokgang Sports Team
					
					 Ri Song Gum, weightlifter of the Ryomyong Sports Team
					
					Kim Myong Hyok, weightlifter of the sports team of Korea University of Physical Education
					
					 Ri Se Gwang, gymnast of the April 25 Sports Team
					
					 Yun Won Chol, wrestler of the April 25 Sports Team
					
					 Rim Jong Sim, weightlifter of the Kigwancha Sports Team
					
					 Ri Myong Guk, footballer of the Pyongyang Sports Team
					
					 Choe Hyo Sim, weightlifter of the Kigwancha Sports Team
					
					 Best coaches:
					
					 Kim Kwang Min (women's football) 
					
					 Sin Jong Rim (diving)
					
					 Ro Hyon Chol (weightlifting)
					
					 Jo Kwang Won (weightlifting)
					
					 Im Sang Ho (weightlifting)
					
					 Sin Myong Su (gymnastics)
					
					 Choe Hak (wrestling)
					
					 Kim Chun Hui (weightlifting)
					
					 Kim Chang Bok (football)
					
					 Kim Chun Phil (gymnastics)
					
					 10 best Taekwon-do players are Rim Ui Sok, Han Song Min, Jang Yong Il, Hong Pom, Kim Il Hwa, Kim Su Ryon, Pak Mi Hyang, Kim Hyang Sim, Sin Jong Hwa and Choe Su Ryon.

articles.title: 2015 Best Footballers Selected in DPRK
articles.content:
2015 Best Footballers Selected in DPRK
 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Football Association made public the list of best footballers of the country for the year 2015.
					 Goalkeeper Ri Myong Guk of the Pyongyang Sports Team and Ra Un Sim of the Amnokgang Sports Team were selected as the best man and woman footballers for the second straight year.
					
					 Ri proved successful in the second round of the 2018 FIFA World Cup Asian Zone qualifiers. And he was awarded a top goalkeeper prize of the 2015 EAFF East Asia Cup.
					
					 Ra led the DPRK team to winning the first place at the EAFF Women's East Asia Cup in 2013 and 2015.
					
					 She won a top scorer prize of the EAFF by scoring three goals in matches against Japanese and south Korean rivals.

articles.title: DPRK Government Delegation Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Government Delegation Back Home
 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- A DPRK government delegation headed by Minister of Public Health Kang Ha Guk came back home Saturday after visiting Angola and Mozambique.

articles.title: DPRK FM Delegation Returns Home
articles.content:
DPRK FM Delegation Returns Home
 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Foreign Ministry led by Vice-Minister Ri Kil Song returned home on Saturday after visiting Mongolia.

articles.title: Results of Premier League in DPRK
articles.content:
Results of Premier League in DPRK
 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- The premier league for the Osandok Prize Sports Contest in the DPRK came to a close on Thursday.
					 The Hwaebul team won the men's title and the April 25 team the women's title of the premier league, which lasted for nearly 20 days on a group round robin and knockout basis. Earlier in the football matches for the DPRK Championships held on a round-robin basis, the former took the second place and the latter the first place.
					
					 The second and third places in men's football matches were taken by the Ministry of Light Industry team and the Sobaeksu team and those in women's matches by Pyongyang and Wolmido teams.

articles.title: Scientific Achievements Made in Forestry of DPRK This Year
articles.content:
Scientific Achievements Made in Forestry of DPRK This Year
 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- The Academy of Forest Science in the DPRK has made signal achievements this year to turn the country into a thick woodland, greenery and orchard.
					 Its Economic Forest Institute bred highly-yielding walnut, pine-nut and chestnut strains and developed a technology of cultivating paulownia sapling.
					
					 The Thremmatology Institute solved sci-tech problems arising in the creation of shelter belts while the Forest Administration Institute developed soil conditioners and other agents good for raising the rate of rooting of trees.
					
					 The Forest Machine Institute opened up a prospect of putting sapling production on an industrial basis and settled many sci-tech problems arising in mechanizing and modernizing the nursing of young trees.

articles.title: "Collection of Kim Il Sung's Anecdotes" Vol. 7 Published
articles.content:
"Collection of Kim Il Sung's Anecdotes" Vol. 7 Published
 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Vol. 7 of "Collection of Kim Il Sung's Anecdotes", a cycle of revolutionary anecdotes, was published in the DPRK.
					 The four-chapter book contains revolutionary anecdotes telling about how President Kim Il Sung led the struggle to build a new country after its liberation from January to September, Juche 35 (1946).
					
					 Contained in the book are anecdotes dealing with the fact that the President indicated the way for new Korea with his first New Year Address after the liberation and aroused all the people to building an independent and sovereign state while giving field guidance to every nook and corner of the country.
					
					 Some anecdotes tell the exploits performed by the President who wisely led the agrarian reform, bringing into a reality the age-long desire of farmers and set a world-wide model in solving the land issue.
					
					 Among them are touching anecdotes dating back to the period when he made public the Twenty-Point Platform and energetically led the struggle to realize it.
					
					 The book also contains anecdotes telling that he made sure the democratic reforms such as labor law and law on the nationalization of major industries were continuously carried out to provide genuine dignity and rights to the people.

articles.title: Inquiry Report Terms S. Korean Regime Worst Human Rights Abuser
articles.content:
Inquiry Report Terms S. Korean Regime Worst Human Rights Abuser
 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Measure Council for Human Rights in South Korea Saturday released an inquiry report dealing with the human rights abuses committed by the present south Korean conservative forces in 2015.
					 According to the report, the pro-U.S. conservative regime of south Korea committed the worst crimes, pursuant to the U.S. imperialists' moves for igniting a bio-chemical war.
					
					 It continues:
					
					 When the U.S. opened to public the introduction of anthrax germs into its military bases in south Korea on May 27, the south Korean regime was busy seeking a loophole only by feigning ignorance of the relevant information.
					
					 The pro-U.S. conservative regime was so shameless as to assert that the north has anthrax and pest germs and may use them for terrorist acts and all-out war. This was to justify the crimes the regime committed for carrying out the U.S. scenario for a bio-chemical war.
					
					 The ruling south Korean conservatives have kicked up the spiraling racket of human rights abuses the year round through the whirlwind of eliminating the "followers of the north", being hell-bent on confrontation with compatriots in the north.
					
					 When the case of knife attack on the U.S. ambassador occurred in Seoul on March 5, the conservative regime groundlessly linked the case with the DPRK, not content with describing the just action of the attacker an "act of terrorism". The case led to a wholesale racket of eliminating the "forces following the north", a "witch-hunt".
					
					 The racket reached an extreme phase recently, as evidenced by the brutal suppression of the public campaign opposing the regime's plan to introduce "state-compiled" textbooks and unpopular rule and demanding democracy and right to existence in south Korea.
					
					 The south Korean Supreme Court decided on closing the progressive internet newspaper Jaju Minbo in February.
					
					 The south Korean regime also let the riot police blast water cannon and poisonous tear liquid against peaceful demonstrators to disperse them.
					
					 The water cannon used by the police against peaceful citizens on April 18 and 24 and May 1 amounted to over 79,000 litres.
					
					 The inquiry report said that the south Korean authorities, in disregard of the people's life and health, failed to take proper preventive measures against epidemics, throwing the whole land of south Korea into appalling confusion. 
					
					 MERS, which broke out on May 20 by a south Korean who visited a Mid-east country, left 95 people infected, 7 dead and at least 2,890 quarantined as of June 8. 
					
					 Owing to the irresponsible and careless attitude of the south Korean authorities, the infection lasted for more than 200 days, infecting 186 people, killing 38 and quarantining at least 16,000. Even now respiratory diseases of unknown causes spread in south Korea, increasing social instability and horror. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities obsessed with confrontation with the fellow countrymen abducted residents of the north, detained and forced them into "defection", separating them from their families against their will. 
					
					 Citing materials disclosing the uproar of unemployment killing working masses, shocking cases of maltreating children, human rights abuses in the south Korean mercenary army and "anti-north human rights" racket, the inquiry report went on:
					
					 In 2015 the south Korean conservative ruling quarters committed human rights abuses in an organized, systemic and indiscriminate way. 
					
					 It is quite natural that the international community branded south Korea as "the worst tundra of human rights on the globe."

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Terms U.S. Harasser of Peace
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Terms U.S. Harasser of Peace 
 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- An American political critic who was a former member of U.S. Congress in a recent interview spoke ill of the present U.S. administration's foreign and human rights policies.
					 Referring to the U.S. military provocations in different parts of the world which plunged not a few countries into wars, the critic commented that it is not an exaggeration to say that the third World War has already started due to the U.S. foreign policy for aggression.
					
					 This is in denunciation of the arch criminal that escalated tension and harassed peace by plunging the world into the crucible of war to meet the ambition for world domination.
					
					 The U.S. fattened after the Second World War is causing wars and armed conflicts in different parts of the world nonstop to lord it over as "emperor".
					
					 Under the signboard of "peace", it is committing aggression wars and armed intervention, harassing the world peace order and inflicting untold misfortune and disaster on the people.
					
					 Under the pretext of "war on terrorism" it has committed aggression wars against weak countries, typically Iraq and Afghanistan. Wherever the misanthropic U.S. forces set their boots there were a number of casualties and disputes between religious sects and tribes, throwing citizens into uneasiness and horror.
					
					 The "war on terrorism" that has lasted more than a decade has thrown the whole Mid-east into an evil cycle of terrorism and retaliation.
					
					 The military and political antagonism is getting serious among countries in the regions which the U.S. dark tentacles have reached, notably Ukraine which turned into the theatre of conflict and stand-off following its disintegration.
					
					 The U.S. moves to dominate the world find their vivid manifestation on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 Calling the Asia policy a key in its foreign policy in the 21st century and the Korean Peninsula a focus in it, the U.S. has persisted in its moves to stifle the DPRK.
					
					 Finding fault with the just measure for self-defence taken by the DPRK to cope with the aggression threats as "provocation and threats", the U.S. has massively beefed up nuclear strike means around the Korean Peninsula, straining the situation in a planned and deliberate way.
					
					 Staging Key Resolve, Foal Eagle and Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises every year, the U.S. described them as drills for "defense" and the ones for "safeguarding" south Korea.  
					
					 The U.S. is the chieftain escalating tension and chief culprit harassing peace as it flatly declined the DPRK's sincere proposals for replacing the Armistice Agreement with a peace treaty and has brought the dark clouds of a war to hang over the peninsula through ceaseless joint military drills.
					
					 Due to the U.S. the world is being inveigled into the whirlwind of war and confusion reminiscent of the world wars in the last century and the hope of the peace-loving people to see peace and stability in the 21st century has not yet come true.
					
					 All the countries of the world loving peace have to see through the criminal nature of the U.S. and intensify the struggle to foil it.

articles.title: Japanese Reactionaries Accused of Suppressing Chongryon
articles.content:
Japanese Reactionaries Accused of Suppressing Chongryon
 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- The Hokkaido police authorities of Japan reportedly arrested three Koreans including an employee of an advisory company outsourced by the Hokkaido Headquarters of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) on charges of submitting a "forged application to get an illegal grant". 
					 Commenting on this, Minju Joson Saturday says:
					
					 It is a trite method of the Japanese reactionaries to invent a groundless case against Chongryon and Koreans in Japan to suppress them, creating a terror-ridden atmosphere.
					
					 The faked-up case is just part of their moves to make the arrestees criminals and under that pretext incite repugnancy toward Chongryon throughout the Japanese society.
					
					 Suppression of Chongryon means an open provocation against the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK will never overlook the Japanese reactionaries' provocative acts against the DPRK and Chongryon.
					
					 The reactionaries should know that their moves against Koreans only add to the crimes already committed.
					
					 They should stop suppressing Chongryon, aware that its unreasonable suppression of Chongryon will only lead to bitterer antagonism of the service personnel and people of the DPRK toward Japan.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Suppression of Participants in People's Action under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Suppression of Participants in People's Action under Fire
 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Voice of People, an internet newspaper of south Korea, in an editorial on Dec. 22 denounced the fascist police's indiscriminate suppression.
					 The editorial recalled that on Dec. 21 the director of the Police Agency blared that it would punish the sponsor of the third all-out people's action held in 13 areas of south Korea.
					
					 This is an act of violating the freedom of assembly, the editorial noted.
					
					 It said that the police regarded the rally as the target of control and punishment for no justifiable reason.

articles.title: KCTU's Sit-in Strike against Retrogressive Revision of Labor Law Supported
articles.content:
KCTU's Sit-in Strike against Retrogressive Revision of Labor Law Supported
Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- The headquarters for all-out people's action of south Korea held a press conference at the site of a sit-in of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Union (KCTU) around the building of the "National Assembly" on Dec. 23 to support the struggle of the KCTU for checking the retrogressive revision of the labor law and suppression under the pretext of security, according to the south Korean newspaper Nodong and Segye.
					In a press release the headquarters said that the present regime continues the attempt at the retrogressive revision of the labor law despite the strong opposition of the people.
					
					The headquarters declared that organizations of various social standings would wage solidarity actions for the KCTU.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Introduced by Uruguayan Radio
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Introduced by Uruguayan Radio
 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- The full text of Marshal Kim Jong Un's work "The Cause of the Great Party of Comrades Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il Is Ever-Victorious" was posted by C. Equis 36 Radio Centenario of Uruguay on its website on Dec. 1.
					 The work, published on October 4, Juche 104 (2015), clarifies the idea that the seven decade-long history of the Workers' Party of Korea is the proud one of victory which demonstrated the validity and invincibility of the cause of the party of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and that the sacred cause of the party is always sure to triumph. 
					
					 The radio broadcasted the full text of the work on the same day.

articles.title: Foreigners Pay Floral Tribute to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Foreigners Pay Floral Tribute to Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Personages of some countries and international and regional organizations visited the DPRK missions in relevant countries from Dec. 10 to 17 to pay homage to leader Kim Jong Il on the 4th anniversary of his demise.
					 They included the deputy chief of the General Staff of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Cuba and his party, president of the Prensa Latina News Agency and his party, director of the Asian Department of the Cuban Institute of Friendship with the Peoples, first vice-chairman of the Cuban Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification, chairman of the Communist Party of Germany, chairman of the Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany, international secretary of the Radical Party of Left of France, general secretary of the France-Korea Friendship Association, permanent secretary of the Guinean People's Assembly, chairman of the Guinean National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism and his party, representative of the Pyongyang branch of the World Federation of Deaf and the councilor of the European Society for the Study of the Juche Idea.
					
					 They put floral baskets and bouquets before the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and art pieces depicting them.
					
					 Meanwhile, the representative of the Belgian branch of the Korean Friendship Association sent a bouquet to the DPRK mission.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Remembered in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Remembered in Foreign Countries
 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Meetings for remembering leader Kim Jong Il were held in Venezuela, Dominica and Pakistan on Dec. 16 and 17.
					 The participants laid floral baskets and bouquets before the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and paid tribute to them.
					
					 The secretary general of the United Left Movement of Dominica said that Kim Jong Il firmly defended the country's sovereignty and national dignity by successfully carrying forward the idea and cause of Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The secretary general of the Karachi Branch of the Pakistan-Korea Friendship Association noted with appreciation that Kim Jong Il conducted energetic activities for the country's prosperity, people's happiness and the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea.
					
					 The chairman of the Lahore Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea of Pakistan stressed that the august name of Kim Jong Il would always be kept in the hearts of the people along with his exploits, lauding him as the tender-hearted father of the people and the great teacher of the progressives.
					
					 Messages to Marshal Kim Jong Un were adopted at the meetings held in Dominica and Pakistan.

articles.title: Kim Jong Suk's Life Will Shine Long: British Organizations
articles.content:
Kim Jong Suk's Life Will Shine Long: British Organizations
 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- The noble life of the great revolutionary fighter and anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk will shine long in the hearts of the woman revolutionaries of the world.
					 The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Korean Friendship Association UK said this in a joint statement on Dec. 18 on the occasion of the 98th anniversary of birth of Kim Jong Suk.
					
					 The statement continued:
					
					 The life of Kim Jong Suk was the one shining as an example for the world woman revolutionaries.
					
					 She joined the Korean People's Revolutionary Army organized and led by President Kim Il Sung and fought hard to beat the gangster-like Japanese imperialists and achieve the independence of the country.
					
					 In a number of battles during the anti-Japanese armed struggle she safeguarded the President with her life.
					
					 After the liberation of the country she actively aided the President.
					
					 The followers of the Juche idea and the Songun idea in Britain look back with deep emotion on her exploits in humblest reverence on the occasion of her 98th birth anniversary.

articles.title: Kuwaiti Newspapers Mark Demise Anniversary of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Kuwaiti Newspapers Mark Demise Anniversary of Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- Kuwaiti newspapers carried special write-ups on the occasion of the 4th anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 They carried photos of President Kim Il Sung standing together with Kim Jong Il and photos of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Al Shahid in an article titled "Pyongyang, remembering HE Leader Kim Jong Il, friend of Arab" said that he was an outstanding statesman and strategist who turned the DPRK into a nuclear weapons state and a country of a single-minded unity and a defender of justice and peace who made undying contribution to the cause of global independence.
					
					 Al-Anba in an article titled "Fourth anniversary of demise of HE Kim Jong Il, leader of Korea" said that his exploits are huge and they can generally be classified into three.
					
					 First, he provided a sure guarantee for the inheritance and completion of the revolutionary cause.
					
					 Second, he consolidated the single-minded unity.
					
					 Third, he provided a nuclear deterrence.
					
					 He also made great contribution to the world peace and security as evidenced by the active support for the just cause of the Arab people to retake the usurped sovereignty, the article added.

articles.title: Bangladeshi Newspapers Praise Exploits of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Bangladeshi Newspapers Praise Exploits of Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- The Bangladeshi newspapers carried articles to mark the 4th anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Dainik Probat on Dec. 11 in an article titled "Heritage left by leader Kim Jong Il" said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il left huge exploits guaranteeing the eternal foundation of socialist Korea and its bright future as his heritage.
					
					 With his energetic ideological and theoretical activities and revolutionary practices he developed in depth the Juche idea and Songun idea and glorified them as the eternal guiding idea of Korea and the great guiding idea in the era of independence.
					
					 He developed the Workers' Party of Korea into the ever-victorious guiding force, the DPRK into an invincible socialist country and the Korean People's Army into a matchless army.
					
					 Blitz on Dec. 12 said that the Korean people are holding Kim Jong Il as the eternal general secretary of the WPK and the eternal chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and adding shine to his exploits.

articles.title: International Body Praises Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
International Body Praises Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, December 26 (KCNA) -- The Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain posted on its website "One Korea Network" an article titled "As real father of families of whole country" on Dec. 15 on the occasion of the 4th anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The article said Kim Jong Il worked heart and soul for the people all his life with the noblest outlook on them.
					
					 Making ceaseless journey of field guidance, he dropped in at the houses of ordinary workers and farmers and looked after their lives, the article said, adding the Korean people will always look up to his kind sunny image and convey down through generations his revolutionary career.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia ofrenda floral ante feretro de difunto Sin Pyong Gang
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia ofrenda floral ante feretro de difunto Sin Pyong Gang
Pyongyang, 26 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un envio el dia 26 una ofrenda floral ante el feretro del difunto Sin Pyong Gang, laureado con el Premio Kim Il Sung y el Premio Kim Jong Il, Heroe del Trabajo, diputado a la Asamblea Popular Suprema y presidente de la Casa de Creacion Literaria y Artistica del Ejercito Popular de Corea, en senal de profundas condolencias por su fallecimiento.

articles.title: Elegidos en RPDC mejores futbolistas de ambos sexos
articles.content:
Elegidos en RPDC mejores futbolistas de ambos sexos 
Pyongyang, 26 de diciembre (ACNC) -- La Asociacion de Futbol de Corea dio a conocer los mejores futbolistas de ambos sexos del 104 (2015) de la Era Juche.
					El futbolista del Conjunto Deportivo de Pyongyang, Ri Myong Guk y la otra del Conjunto Deportivo Amnokgang, Ra Un Sim volvieron a ser elegidos como mejores futbolistas.
					
					El jugador Ri mostro su capacidad del portero prestigioso en 7 partidos de ida y vuelta (junio-noviembre) de la segunda etapa en el marco de las eliminatorias de la region asiatica para la Copa Mundial de la FIFA 2018.
					
					Ademas, recibio el premio de portero superior en la competencia por la Copa de Este de Asia de la Federacion de las Asociaciones de Futbol del Este de Asia 2015.
					
					La futbolista Ra es capitan del equipo de futbol femenino que se considera como campeona asiatica por sus exitos logrados en los ultimos anos.
					
					Ra contribuyo a que el equipo coreano saliera mejor otra vez en el torneo por la Copa Femenina de Este de Asia de la Federacion de las Asociaciones de Futbol del Este de Asia 2015 como lo hizo en 2013.
					
					Metio tres goles en los partidos con el equipo japones y el surcoreano y recibio el premio de goleadora superior.

articles.title: Entidad de RPDC revela crimenes anti-DDHH en Sur de Corea en 2015
articles.content:
Entidad de RPDC revela crimenes anti-DDHH en Sur de Corea en 2015
Pyongyang, 26 de diciembre (ACNC) -- La Sociedad de Medidas de DDHH en el Sur de Corea publico el dia 26 una informacion de investigacion que revela los crimenes anti-DDHH cometidos en el presente ano por las actuales fuerzas conservadoras en poder del Sur de Corea.
					Segun el documento, las autoridades conservadoras proyanquis cometieron el crimen de categoria especial sumandose a las maniobras de provocacion de guerra bioquimica del imperialismo estadounidense.
					
					El pasado dia 27 de mayo cuando EE.UU. dio publicidad enganosa sobre la introduccion ilegal de los bacilos de antracosis de sus tropas ocupantes del Sur de Corea, las autoridades surcoreanas se apresuran a evadir las responsabilidades diciendo que no recibieron ninguna informacion previa de las tropas norteamericanas sobre el caso.
					
					Las autoridades surcoreanas intentaban justificar su sumision a las maniobras de guerra bioquimica de EE.UU. hablando de que "el Norte de Corea posee los bacilos de antracosis y peste y puede usarlos posiblemente en el terrorismo y la guerra total".
					
					Todo el ano desde los principios, el Sur de Corea estaba lleno del clima de exterminio de DDHH debido a la campana por la "purga de las fuerzas pro-Norte" inventada por las fuerzas conservadoras en poder, enloquecidas por la confrontacion fratricida.
					
					Cuando ocurrio el 5 de marzo en Seul el incidente de castigo al embajador estadounidense, las autoridades conservadoras surcoreanas calificaron la accion justa del habitante surcoreano Kim Ki Jong de "terror" y se entregaron a la "purga de las fuerzas pro-Norte", "caza de bruja" vinculando el caso con la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					En estos dias, reprimen barbaramente la lucha de los habitantes de distintos estratos contra la aplicacion del "sistema de manual de historia redactado por el gobierno" y las politicas antipopulares y por la democracia y el derecho a vivir.
					
					La Corte Suprema del Sur de Corea decidio en febrero pasado la supresion de la publicacion del progresista periodico online surcoreano "Jaju Minbo".
					
					Los mitines y manifestaciones pacificas de los habitantes surcoreanos fueron aplastados cruelmente por el uso del mortal canon de agua y el liquido lacrimogeno toxico de las autoridades conservadoras.
					
					Llega a mas de 79 mil litros la cantidad de aguas lanzadas por canones contra los participantes en mitines y manifestaciones pacificas.
					
					Las autoridades surcoreanas no tomaron a tiempo ni siquiera las medidas preventivas y asi llevaron su territorio al gran caos.
					
					MERS, comenzado con la infeccion de un surcoreano que regreso el pasado 20 de mayo de un pais del Medio Oriente, engendro hasta el 8 de junio 95 contagiados, 7 muertos y mas de 2 mil 890 pacientes aislados. 
					
					Debido a las medidas irresponsables de las autoridades, el estado de enfermedad contagiosa perduro mas de 200 dias y dejo como saldo 186 personas contagiadas, 38 muertas y mas de 16 mil aisladas. Tambien hoy en dia se aumentan la inquietud social y el pavor debido a que se propagan sin parar las enfermedades de aparatos respiratorios cuyo origen es desconocido.
					
					Las autoridades surcoreanas, enloquecidas por la confrontacion fratricida, cometen sin vacilacion alguna los crimenes antieticos y anti-DDHH de destruir las familias  armoniosas y separar a fuerza sus parientes mediante la seduccion, el rapto, la retencion forzosa y la coaccion de "sumision" a los habitantes de la RPDC.
					
					La informacion revela con datos los crimenes de violacion de DDHH de las fuerzas conservadoras en el poder incluyendo el gran disturbio de desempleados, el espantoso maltrato infantil, la violacion de derechos humanos en el interior del ejercito mercenario colonial y la campana de "DDHH" anti-RPDC de los criminales de DDHH, y prosigue: 
					
					Asi, los actos violadores de DDHH se cometieron organizativa, sistematica y desesperadamente este ano en el territorio surcoreano por las fuerzas conservadoras en el poder.
					
					Es muy natural que la sociedad internacional califique el suelo surcoreano de "infierno de DDHH mas horrible de este planeta".
